summary: This document appears to be a personnel list or organizational chart for Jeffrey Epstein's operations, detailing roles for his private airline (TWA) and his estate (LSJE - Little St. James Estate). It lists pilots, managers, boat captains, housekeepers, landscapers, maintenance staff, and flight escorts.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Listed as the 'Principle' at the top of the personnel/organizational chart for TWA and LSJE operations.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Listed as the Head Pilot for Epstein's private airline, TWA, and also appears in the LSJE Employees list.

persons.name: William Di Mauro
persons.context: Listed as the Assistant Pilot for TWA and also appears in the LSJE Employees list.

persons.name: Ann M. Rodriquez
persons.context: Listed as a Manager for LSJE (Little St. James Estate).

persons.name: Danny Vicars
persons.context: Listed as an LSJE Employee; appears twice in the list.

persons.name: Carlos Rodriguez
persons.context: Listed as an LSJE Employee and also separately as an LSJE Escort.

persons.name: Ramon Linderman
persons.context: Listed as an LSJE Employee and also separately as an LSJE Escort.

persons.name: Pierressaint Danny Vicars

connections.description: Epstein is listed as the 'Principle' and Visoski as the 'TWA Head Pilot', indicating an employment relationship.
Epstein is listed as the 'Principle' and Di Mauro as the 'Assistant Pilot', indicating an employment relationship.
Epstein is listed as the 'Principle' and Rodriquez as an 'LSJE Manager', indicating an employment relationship.
Epstein is listed as the 'Principle' and Rodriguez is listed as both an LSJE Employee and Escort, indicating an employment relationship.
Both are listed as pilots (Head and Assistant) for Epstein's TWA operation.
Both are listed as LSJE Employees and separately as LSJE Escorts.
Both are listed as Managers, Rodriquez for LSJE and Romney for VIPA (Virgin Islands Port Authority), suggesting a professional interface.

keyFacts: The document outlines the staffing structure for Jeffrey Epstein's private airline (TWA) and his Little St. James Estate (LSJE).
It lists specific roles including pilots, managers, boat captains, housekeepers, landscapers, maintenance staff, and notably, 'LSJE Escort(s)'.
The presence of 'Escort(s)' as a distinct staff category for LSJE is a notable detail in the context of the Epstein case.
The document connects Epstein's operations to specific locations in St. Thomas, including the airport, jet center, and his estate.
It shows a clear hierarchy with Epstein as the 'Principle' at the top, followed by managers and various operational staff.
